Package algorithms.imageProcessing

Class IntegralHistograms

java.lang.Object
algorithms.imageProcessing.IntegralHistograms
public class IntegralHistograms extends Object
algorithm based upon paper "Integral Histogram: A Fast Way to Extract Histograms in Cartesian Spaces" by Porikli 2005 Algorithm uses a pattern similar to a summed area table to cumulatively add the content from one lower pixel in x and in y with a runtime complexity that is O(N_pixels), but a space complexity that is O(N_pixels * nBins) where nBins is the number of bins in a histogram (default is 16 for default value range of 0 to 255, inclusive).
Author:
nichole

      includePixels - set of pixel coords to include, but if this is null all pixels are included
      minValue -

      nBins -
      Returns:

    • extractWindowFromIntegralHistograms

      public void extractWindowFromIntegralHistograms(int[][] integralHistograms, int width, int height, int x, int y, int d, int[] output, int[] outputN)
      NOT YET TESTED extract the sum of a window centered at (x,y) of x dimension d and y dimension d and return that summed histogram and the number of pixels in the aperture in the output variables, output and outputN. NOTE GreyscaleImage, x, and y are in column major format
      Parameters:
      integralHistograms -
      width - the width of the image that integeralHistograms was made from.
      height - the height of the image that integeralHistograms was made from.
      x - coordinate for x center of window
      y - coordinate for y center of window
      d - diameter of window in x and y
      output - one dimensional array of size nBins in which the sum of the histograms in the window will be returned.
      outputN - the number of pixels in the window. if the window size extends beyond the borders of the "image", this number will be smaller than d * d.

    • applyWindowedSum

    • extractWindow

      public void extractWindow(int[][] histograms, int startX, int stopX, int startY, int stopY, int w, int h, int[] output, int[] outputN)
      extract the sum of histograms in the window inclusively defined as (startX:stopX, startY:stopY). runtime complexity is O(nBins)
      Parameters:
      histograms - the 2D histogram integral image. the first dimension is the pixel index and the 2nd is the histogram bin, e.g. histograms[pixIdx][binIdx].
      startX -
      stopX - the last x pixel in the window, inclusive
      startY -
      stopY - the last y pixel in the window, inclusive
      output -
      outputN - an empty 1 dimensional array of size 1 to return the number of pixels in the cell

    • extractWindow

      public void extractWindow(int[][] histograms, int startX, int stopX, int startY, int stopY, int w, int h, long[] output, int[] outputN)
      extract the sum of histograms in the window inclusively defined as (startX:stopX, startY:stopY). runtime complexity is O(nBins)
      Parameters:
      histograms - the 2D histogram integral image. the first dimension is the pixel index and the 2nd is the histogram bin, e.g. histograms[pixIdx][binIdx].
      startX -
      stopX - the last x pixel in the window, inclusive
      startY -
      stopY - the last y pixel in the window, inclusive
      output -
      outputN - an empty 1 dimensional array of size 1 to return the number of pixels in the cell
